11#include <memory>
12#include <vector>
13
14#include "common_video/h265/h265_common.h"
15#include "common_video/h265/h265_vps_parser.h"
16#include "rtc_base/bit_buffer.h"
17#include "rtc_base/logging.h"
18
19namespace {
20typedef absl::optional<webrtc::H265VpsParser::VpsState> OptionalVps;
21
22#define RETURN_EMPTY_ON_FAIL(x) \
23 if (!(x)) { \
24 return OptionalVps(); \
25 }
26} // namespace
27
28namespace webrtc {
29
30H265VpsParser::VpsState::VpsState() = default;
31
32// General note: this is based off the 02/2018 version of the H.265 standard.
33// You can find it on this page:
34// http://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-H.265
35
36// Unpack RBSP and parse SPS state from the supplied buffer.
37absl::optional<H265VpsParser::VpsState> H265VpsParser::ParseVps(
38 const uint8_t* data,
39 size_t length) {
40 std::vector<uint8_t> unpacked_buffer = H265::ParseRbsp(data, length);
41 rtc::BitBuffer bit_buffer(unpacked_buffer.data(), unpacked_buffer.size());
42 return ParseInternal(&bit_buffer);
43}
44
45absl::optional<H265VpsParser::VpsState> H265VpsParser::ParseInternal(
46 rtc::BitBuffer* buffer) {
47 // Now, we need to use a bit buffer to parse through the actual HEVC VPS
48 // format. See Section 7.3.2.1 ("Video parameter set RBSP syntax") of the
49 // H.265 standard for a complete description.
50
51 VpsState vps;
52
53 // vps_video_parameter_set_id: u(4)
54 uint32_t vps_video_parameter_set_id = 0;
55 RETURN_EMPTY_ON_FAIL(buffer->ReadBits(&vps_video_parameter_set_id, 4));
56
57 vps.id = vps_video_parameter_set_id;
58 vps.id = 0;
59 return OptionalVps(vps);
60}
61
62} // namespace webrtc
63
